rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 9 to survive.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 10 to survive. Adjacent bunnies must roll higher than 9 to survive.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny. The bunny and all other bunnies of the same color (or half color) must roll higher than 11 to survive.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which dies immediately. All bunnies within two spaces are also killed. Horseshoe bunnies may survive.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed under any bunny and protects it from all harm, hunger, misfortune and abduction. A bunny with Angel Wings may, however, defect, be auctioned, be exchanged or gambled.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text:
Once assigned to a bunny, Angel Wings cannot be moved to another bunny. If the bunny with Angel Wings changes owners, then the Halo goes with it. If a player runs Angel Wings card but has no bunny in The Bunny Circle, then he may either place it on any opponent's bunny in The Bunny Circle or simply discard the card.

Angel Wings is a Modifier card, and by itself is not a bunny. Angel Wings protects any one bunny from all harm (Weapons), hunger (Feed The Bunny or Gorge The Bunny), misfortune (Terrible) and abduction (Area 51 or the Mothership). A bunny with Angel Wings may, however, defect (Defector Detector), be auctioned (Bunny Block Bid), be exchanged (Bunny Exchange) or gambled (Poverty Poker and Texas Let Go).

If a player's only bunny has Angel Wings, then he may not play any Aggressive cards (cards that have a Pink rectangular box). Remember that Choose A Carrot cards are not Aggressive cards even though they have the Pink rectangular box.

rules.title: Counter-Clock Warlock
rules.text: Counter-Clock Warlock may be used to move Angel Wings to another Bunny in The Bunny Circle.

rules.title: Under Blunder
rules.text: Under Blunder may be used to remove Angel Wings from a Bunny.

rules.title: Demonic barbecue Sauce
rules.text: Demonic barbecue Saucer may be used to move Angel Wings to another Bunny in The Bunny Circle.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any one bunny which is abducted by the Beyea Aliens. The bunny is returned when another is taken.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text:
If an abducted bunny has any Bunny Modifier cards (such as Clover or the Containment Suit), or a pending card (such as a Feed The Bunny card, The Trojan Bunny or The Ebola Virus), then those cards are immediately discarded.

If the bunny that is abducted has Cyber Bunny on top of it, then the bunny goes away with the Beyea Aliens and Cyber Bunny moves on to the next viable bunny target in The Bunny Circle.

A player with an abducted bunny and no other bunny in The Bunny Circle may not play any Aggressive cards (cards that have a Pink rectangular box) or a Choose A Carrot card. An abducted bunny cannot count towards a Bunny Triplet because it is not in The Bunny Circle. At the end of the game, a player with only an abducted bunny may still win the game (since the bunny is still alive).

rules.title: Hitchbunny's Guide
rules.text: Hitchbunny's Guide can be used to retrieve this card from the discard pile because it contains a picture of the planet Jupiter.

rules.title: Bunnies In Black
rules.text: Bunnies In Black can be used to protect a player's bunnies from abduction, or used to return all abducted bunnies.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any one bunny which is abducted by the Beyea Aliens. The bunny is returned when another is taken.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text:
If an abducted bunny has any Bunny Modifier cards (such as Clover or the Containment Suit), or a pending card (such as a Feed The Bunny card, The Trojan Bunny or The Ebola Virus), then those cards are immediately discarded.

If the bunny that is abducted has Cyber Bunny on top of it, then the bunny goes away with the Beyea Aliens and Cyber Bunny moves on to the next viable bunny target in The Bunny Circle.

A player with an abducted bunny and no other bunny in The Bunny Circle may not play any Aggressive cards (cards that have a Pink rectangular box) or a Choose A Carrot card. An abducted bunny cannot count towards a Bunny Triplet because it is not in The Bunny Circle. At the end of the game, a player with only an abducted bunny may still win the game (since the bunny is still alive).

rules.title: Hitchbunny's Guide
rules.text: Hitchbunny's Guide can be used to retrieve this card from the discard pile because it contains a picture of the planet Jupiter.

rules.title: Bunnies In Black
rules.text: Bunnies In Black can be used to protect a player's bunnies from abduction, or used to return all abducted bunnies.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to remove all Horseshoe cards from any one bunny. An Odd roll allows the player to keep the Horseshoe cards and to place them under any bunny.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by all players to purchase numbers (1-12) for 1 Dolla each. If the number rolled was purchased by a player then he may choose a Carrot.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to force any one opponent to lose his next turn unless he can roll a 9.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: The opponent may or may not have a bunny of his own in The Bunny Circle.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must roll higher than 9 to survive. Dragon Of Doom continues attacking one bunny per round clockwise around The Bunny Circle. Dragon Of Doom may be killed using any weapon.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text:
Dragon Of Doom is not a weapon and cannot be subjugated by using Horseshoe cards or Defense Cards.

After the attack, Dragon Of Doom moves to the next viable bunny target and waits until the next round of play. Dragon Of Doom can attack the same bunny more than once during its time in The Bunny Circle. When Dragon Of Doom encounters a Barrier, it will change direction and could easily attack the same bunny twice (on consecutive turns).

Dragon Of Doom itself may be attacked and eliminated using any Weapon card. The player who launched Dragon Of Doom rolls for its defense against a Weapon card even if the same player also launched the weapon. During play, Dragon Of Doom will be waiting on top of a bunny (the next viable bunny target). If a weapon is designed to attack a single bunny, then a player may direct it onto Dragon Of Doom, or the bunny underneath, but not both. If the weapon is a range weapon (such as Googol Plexing or Terminators), then both Dragon Of Doom and the bunny underneath are affected equally (whether they were the direct target of the weapon or within the weapon's range).

If Dragon Of Doom has no viable bunny targets left in The Bunny Circle, then it is discarded. A bunny with Angel Wings would be an example of a non-viable bunny target since it cannot be killed by Dragon Of Doom. If Dragon Of Doom is confined to an area of The Bunny Circle by two or more Barriers and cannot reach a viable bunny target on the other side, then it is removed (discarded).

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player as a bunny of any kind and any color (except Red or Pink).

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: Free Agent bunny may be used by a player as any bunny of any kind (Evil, Hypnotic, Ludicrous, Spiffy and Truculent) and any color (except Red or Pink). The identity of the bunny may change at any time during play as the need arises. Free Agent bunnies make forming a Bunny Triplet much easier. Free Agent bunnies cannot become Specialty bunnies or Celebrity bunnies.

rules.title: Cloning
rules.text: This bunny cannot be Cloned

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text:
Reopens the store - New Prices:
  • 4 Dolla - for each Radish Card
  • 5 Dolla - for each Milk Card
  • 10 Dolla - for each Carrot

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed under any bunny. Lucky Horseshoe Single lowers the level of any weapon by one.

rules.title: 50/50 Weapons
rules.text: 50/50 Weapons are not affected by Horseshoe modifiers.

rules.title: Gender Weapons
rules.text: Gender Weapons are not affected by Horseshoe modifiers.

rules.title: Abduction
rules.text: Horseshoe modifiers are discarded when a bunny is abducted by Area 51 or the Mothership.

rules.title: Horseshoes and Hand Grenade
rules.text: Horseshoes and Hand Grenade can be used to kill Horseshoe Bunnies by forcing them to roll higher than their total number of horseshoes to survive.

rules.title: Bamboozled Blacksmith
rules.text: Bamboozled Blacksmith can be used to remove Horseshoes from a bunny.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to force all opponents who have at least 2 Dolla to give him 2 Dolla.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once to force any one player to immediately lose all of his Milk Units.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: The player also loses any Milk Vouchers that he may have been saving.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once to force any one player to immediately lose all of his Radish Units.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: The player also loses any Radish Vouchers that he may have been saving.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Allows a player to force his opponents to gamble for any number of objects. Everyone who can play must play. THe highest roller takes all. The player may re-roll the die.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text:
Texas Let Go allows a player to force his opponents to gamble for any number of items. These items can be Radish Units, Milk Units, Carrots, Dolla, Metal cards or bunnies. Later on, booster decks will introduce other items such as: Defense Units, Pawns, Zodiac cards, and Mysterious Place cards.

The player who uses Texas Let Go must decide what the stakes will be for the gamble. Everyone who can play must play. For example, let's pretend that a fictional player Carol decided to play Texas Let Go for 2 Kaballa Dolla and 1 Carrot. Each player with at least 2 Kaballa Dolla and 1 Carrot must play. All players involved in the gamble roll any one of the 12-sided dice. The highest roller takes all of the Kaballa Dolla and all of the Carrots. Of course Carol must participate in her own gamble.

The player who played Texas Let Go may re-roll the die if he does not like his first roll. If two players tie for the highest roll, then both players must roll the 12-sided die again (and keep rolling) until the tie is broken.

If the stakes involve a Carrot or a bunny, then each opponent may choose which Carrot or bunny to risk. If the player's stakes include a bunny and an opponent's only bunny has Angel Wings, then he must risk the bunny.

rules.title: Heavenly Halo
rules.text: Texas Let Go is one of the few cards which can be used to take a bunny wearing The Heavenly Halo.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to roll the dice and to steal a saved Special or Very Special card from any opponent for each 12 rolled.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to force the last opponent who received a Carrot to give any one of his Carrots to the player.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text:
May be placed on any bunny in The Bunny Circle. Roll the dice and add the numbers (Modulo 10).
6-7-8-9 = Choose a Carrot from Kaballa's and one Metal card from Morden's Metals Exchange.
4-5 = Feed the bunny 1 Radish Unit and 1 Milk Unit.2-3 - Pay any two Metal cards to Morden's ME.
0-1 - The bunny gets a one-way ride into the desert by the Casino bosses (discarded)!

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text:
The player must choose the bunny that will take the risk for the card. This target bunny can be one of his own bunnies or any opponent's bunny in The Bunny Circle.

If the consequence for a bunny is to feed, then it must be done immediately. An opponent with no saved Radish Units or saved Milk Units will not have the opportunity to buy supplies from Kaballa's Market Two since it will not be his turn.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text:

6-7-8-9 = Choose a Carrot from Kaballa's and one Metal card from Morden's Metals Exchange.
4-5 = Feed the bunny 1 Radish Unit and 1 Milk Unit.2-3 - Pay any two Metal cards to Morden's ME.
0-1 - The bunny gets a one-way ride into the desert by the Casino bosses (discarded)!

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text:
The player must choose the bunny that will take the risk for the card. This target bunny can be one of his own bunnies or any opponent's bunny in The Bunny Circle.

If the consequence for a bunny is to feed, then it must be done immediately. An opponent with no saved Radish Units or saved Milk Units will not have the opportunity to buy supplies from Kaballa's Market Two since it will not be his turn.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text:
The color die that has the lowest roll is the supply taken by the player:
  • Violet = A bunny card.
  • Orange = A Carrot card.
  • Green = A Radish card.
  • Yellow = A Metal card.
  • Blue = A Milk card.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text:
If two or more dice roll the lowest number, then the player may take more than one supply.

Carrots, Radish Cards and Milk Cards are taken from Kaballa's Market Two (if the market is open). Bunnies are taken from the Discard Pile, and Metal cards are taken from Morden's Metals Exchange if they are available.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text:
The color die that has the lowest roll is the supply taken by the player:
  • Violet = A bunny card.
  • Orange = A Carrot card.
  • Green = A Radish card.
  • Yellow = A Metal card.
  • Blue = A Milk card.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text:
If two or more dice roll the lowest number, then the player may take more than one supply.

Carrots, Radish Cards and Milk Cards are taken from Kaballa's Market Two (if the market is open). Bunnies are taken from the Discard Pile, and Metal cards are taken from Morden's Metals Exchange if they are available.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to feed the bunny. One bunny is fed any amounts of Radish Units and Milk Units. Or may be used immediately by a player to eliminate the Whiner vote. This card must be a saved Special to be used immediately.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to feed the bunny. One bunny is fed any amounts of Radish Units and Milk Units. Or may be used immediately by a player to eliminate the Whiner vote. This card must be a saved Special to be used immediately.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to take two Milk Cards from Kaballa's Market Two.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: Free Milk may not be used if Kaballa's Market Two is closed.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to take two Radish Cards from Kaballa's Market Two.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: Free Radish may not be used if Kaballa's Market Two is closed.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used by a player to pay or receive 3 Dolla for every Metal card at Morden's Metals Exchange regardless of the current Exchange Rate.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: Guarantee At Three can be used to buy or sell as many Metal cards as a player wishes during one turn only.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to roll the die and to take the same number of cards from the Draw Pile. The player may keep the best cards and discard the rest. The player must have five cards in his hand (and two cards down) at the end of his turn. Or may be used immediately by a player to eliminate the Shiner vote. This card must be a saved Special to be used immediately.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to roll the die and to take the same number of cards from the Draw Pile. The player may keep the best cards and discard the rest. The player must have five cards in his hand (and two cards down) at the end of his turn. Or may be used immediately by a player to eliminate the Shiner vote. This card must be a saved Special to be used immediately.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to choose any number (1-12) and roll the dice. The number of correct rolls is the number of bunnies the player may revive from the Discard Pile and immediately place into The Bunny Circle.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to choose any number (1-12) and roll the dice. The number of correct rolls is the number of bunnies the player may revive from the Discard Pile and immediately place into The Bunny Circle.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to feed any bunny with one of his own bunnies in The Bunny Circle. May be used at any time!

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: The Feed The Bunny card and the bunny sacrificed are immediately discarded.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to roll the dice and to increase (two Odd rolls) or decrease (two Even rolls) the level of any weapon being played by the number on either of the dice rolled. May be used at any time!

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: The player must choose which of the two dice to use. If one Odd and one Even number are rolled, then there is no change to the level of the weapon.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: While attempting to birl a log, your bunny slips and abruptly realizes that he can't just roll with it.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: If a player draws a PLAY IMMEDIATELY card but has no bunny in The Bunny Circle, then he must place the card on an opponent's bunny in The Bunny Circle causing it to die (discarded). This is also true if the player's only bunny in The Bunny Circle is protected by The Heavenly Halo or Angel Wings

rules.title: Protection
rules.text: The Heavenly Halo and Angel Wings will protect a bunny from any terrible misfortune. The Guardian Angle can be used to eliminate a Terrible Misfortune.

rules.title: Mysterious Place
rules.text: The player who currently holds the Yellow Ball can control the destiny of this card. The opponent must play the card first, then the player holding the Yellow Ball may redirect it to any other player, bunny or the Discard Pile.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: One of your bunnies becomes the victim of a poorly calibrated heart defibrillator.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: If a player draws a PLAY IMMEDIATELY card but has no bunny in The Bunny Circle, then he must place the card on an opponent's bunny in The Bunny Circle causing it to die (discarded). This is also true if the player's only bunny in The Bunny Circle is protected by The Heavenly Halo or Angel Wings

rules.title: Protection

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: One of your bunnies attempts to take over a high rise building on Christmas Eve and dies hard.

rules.title: Additional Rules

rules.text:
Starting prices for supplies:
3 Dolla - for each Radish Card
3 Dolla - for each Milk Card
10 Dolla - for each Carrot

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Metals may be bought or sold for the current Exchange Rate. All Metal dice may be re-rolled at the end of any turn during which a player received a Carrot.
